author: Simon Robb For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Schoolgirl takes photo of paedophile as he tries to abduct her | Metro News
text:
Simon Robb for Metro.co.uk Saturday 18 Feb 2017 5:24 pm Roger Seath cornered the girl against a wall (Picture: Hampshire Police/Solent News) 
A paedophile was caught after a quick-thinking schoolgirl took a picture of him as he tried to snatch her in the street. Shops will soon be able to refuse your round pounds 
Roger Seath, 45, cornered the 14-year-old girl against a wall and threatened to ‘spank’ her if she didn’t go with him. 
But she snapped a photo of her attacker and grabbed the attention of a driver in Southsea, Hampshire. 
When police arrived on the scene, Seath reportedly said: ‘Guilty as charged.’ Videos of schoolgirls he followed were found on his phone (Picture: Hampshire Police/Solent News) 
The girl, who cannot be named for legal reasons, said her mother had told her to take a picture of any stranger who approached her. Virgin Holidays to offer 'autism-friendly' packages 
Judge Anne Arnold said: ‘Because she, very fortunately, had been pre-warned by her parent and was an intelligent and alert girl with sufficient wherewithal to do exactly what she’d been told to do if approached by somebody such as yourself and that was why she took your photograph, freezing your approach long enough to be assisted.’ 
Police later found videos on his iPhone of other schoolgirls he’d been following. 
In footage shown to the court, Seath films two girls, saying: ‘The smaller one is cuter though, the 14-year-old wasn’t interested, I offered her 20 quid and everything.’ He was sentenced to 33 months in jail at Portsmouth Crown Court (Picture: Getty) 
Seath was also found to have 300 images of girls from a social media site. Woman donates rare £5 note, worth up to £50,000, to charity 
And he made 4,246 searches on his phone in one week, most of them related to teenage girls. Seath admitted attempted abduction with intent to commit a sexual offence and having a bladed article – a butter knife – in a public place. He was sentenced to 33 months in jail. He must also sign the sex offenders’ register for 10 years, as well as a lifetime order which restricts his access to children, and pay a £170 victim surcharge. More
